entries.meaning: (inorganic chemistry) A divalent radical or anion containing two oxygen atoms linked by a covalent bond; any substance containing this group which yields hydrogen peroxide when treated with an acid.
Hydrogen peroxide, especially when in an aqueous solution used as a bleach.
(organic chemistry) Any compound containing the functional group R-O-O-R'.

verbs.description: peroxide (third-person singular simple present peroxides, present participle peroxiding, simple past and past participle peroxided)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To treat (something) with hydrogen peroxide, especially hair in order to bleach it.
